meanings.definition: Heavy or sluggish in motion or thought.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, my legs felt loggy and tired.
meanings.sent2: The bear moved in a loggy manner through the thick forest.
meanings.sent3: The loggy turtle tried to race against the speedy rabbit.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt loggy with exhaustion after studying all night.
meanings.sent5: The loggy elephant struggled to keep up with the rest of the herd.

meanings.sent1: The loggy cabin blended perfectly with the forest surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The old table had a loggy appearance due to its rough wooden texture.
meanings.sent3: The loggy costume made him look like a walking tree.
meanings.sent4: Her loggy hair cascaded down her back like a waterfall of wood.
meanings.sent5: The loggy walls of the house gave it a cozy, rustic feel.

meanings.definition: To become clogged or bogged down.
meanings.sent1: The drain started to loggy with leaves and debris.
meanings.sent2: The wheels of the car loggyed in the thick mud.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally loggied the sink by letting food scraps go down the drain.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts began to loggy as he tried to come up with a solution.
meanings.sent5: The river loggied with fallen branches after the storm.
